_header: Ye are too much as in my debt madam
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a roundel, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 47) — 14 lines

BLHar682.First Lines:
YE are to moche as in my dette madame Ye owe me swete to many
                    cossis dere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…Which wold full fayne if hit were yowr plesere Ye payde hem
                    me in savyng of yowre name
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-2 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
